top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Revival's Tennessee rolling gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Gravel Revival's Rolling gravel, Rural Tennessee forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Revival's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
75 miles on Tennessee rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Revival. Train it until it feels boring.
At Gravel Revival, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Tennessee rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Revival, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for Gravel Revival. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,000ft of climbing on Tennessee rolling gravel does to your power file on race day.
Varied gradients on Tennessee rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Revival’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Revival requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on tennessee rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: rolling gravel, rural tennessee, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of tennessee rolling gravel in Hickman County, Tennessee.
